required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Meibomian Gland Expression on Corneal Aberrations in MGD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Meibomian Gland Thermal Massage on Corneal Aberrations in Meibomian Gland Dysfunction Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the influence of corneal-aberrations before and after the meibomian gland thermal massage treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: 62 MGD patients treated with meibomian gland thermal massage once a week for 3 to 4 weeks were recruited.The Ocular Surface Disease Index questionnaire; tear film assessment encompassing tear meniscus height and non-invasive keratograph breakup time ; meibography score,corneal fluorescein staining; the Schirmer I test ; expressible meibomian gland, and quality ,anterior and total corneal aberrations were evaluated before and after treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Corneal aberrations were measured with a Pentacam。 The anterior corneal wavefront aberration was expanded with normalized Zernike polynomials.The corneal aberration from 3rd to 6th order were recorded as the root mean square (RMS) for analysis.

study_pop.textblock: Diagnosed as meibomian glands dysfunction in our hospital; treatment with thermal massage and expression

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- tear break-up time (BUT) ≤10 seconds or Schirmer I test (SIT) ≤10 mm, the presence of dry eye symptoms, and fluorescein staining (FL) score <3 points and at least one lid margin abnormality and poor meibomian gland expressibility
Exclusion Criteria:
- eyelid structure abnormal(Entropion , ectropion);
- having received any other treatment for MGD within three months
- history of ocular surgery
- contact lens use
- ocular infection
- any type of corneal scarring

facility.name: Eye Hospital of Wenzhou Medical College

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice president of Eye Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
